de.fhb.sailboat.gui
Class GUInterface

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      de.fhb.sailboat.gui.GUInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class GUInterface
extends javax.swing.JFrame

A slim general user interface for an autonomous sailboat. Requires a correct GUILogic class to be assigned via constructor as well as a Planner. The GUILogic is assigned hard-coded inside the constructor itself and determines all program logic besides basic interface handling (buttons etc). The Planner will be used to send missions and similar instructions and only needs to be assigned via an instance during constructor calls. Note that using a null-Reference here might result in Exceptions or unexpected behavior, although most problematic calls will check for a null-Reference.

Author:
Patrick Rutter
See Also:
Serialized Form

remoteDialogWindowActivated

private void remoteDialogWindowActivated(java.awt.event.WindowEvent evt)
Called whenever the remoteDialog is called up. Reassigns slider values and radioButtons to represent the currect instruction set of the boat.

Parameters:
evt -

sailStateChanged

private void sailStateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent evt)
This method will be called wehenever the slider for the sail in the remoteDialog is changed. If the (new) value of the slider differs from what is stored as the current value in the world model (translated to the correct instruction value & checked via GUILogic/ Controller) this value will be send as new sail command.

Parameters:
evt -

rudderStateChanged

private void rudderStateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent evt)
This method will be called wehenever the slider for the rudder in the remoteDialog is changed. If the (new) value of the slider differs from what is stored as the current value in the world model (translated to the correct instruction value & checked via GUILogic/ Controller) this value will be send as new rudder command.

Parameters:
evt -

propellorMinStateChanged

propellorNullStateChanged

private void propellorNullStateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent evt)

propellorMaxStateChanged

private void propellorMaxStateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent evt)

propellorStateUpdate

private void propellorStateUpdate()
This method will be called wehenever the radioButtons for the propellor in the remoteDialog are modified. If the (new) status of the radioButtons differs from what is stored as the current value in the world model (translated to the correct instruction value & checked via GUILogic/ Controller) this value will be send as new propellor command.

convertToNativeValue

private int convertToNativeValue(int value,
                                 int min,
                                 int nul,
                                 int max)
Converts a given value from -100 to +100 into the target range. Created for converting the range of the slider values to a concrete value to be used as instruction value for the planner. Requires of the values to be following a general trend (min < nul < max).

Parameters:
value - to be converted
min - minimum target value (equals -100 slider)
nul - neutral target value (equals 0 slider)
max - maximum target value (equals +100 slider)
Returns:
converted value

convertFromNativeValue

private int convertFromNativeValue(int value,
                                   int min,
                                   int nul,
                                   int max)
Works like convertToNativeValue with the only difference that a native actor value is mapped to the slider range from -100 (min) till 100 (max).

Parameters:
to - be converted
min - minimum target value (equals -100 slider)
nul - neutral target value (equals 0 slider)
max - maximum target value (equals +100 slider)
Returns:
converted value

guiLoop

private void guiLoop()
Creates and starts up a thread which updates the values to be displayed by the interface. Utilizes the chosen guiLogic class. Tasks beyond mere updating/ assigning values should be delegated to updateLogic() of the GUILogic.
